name: Marketplace
context: Discovered on small clay tablets among the ruins of what appears to be merchant stalls in the old marketplace. The tablets were remarkably well preserved, suggesting they were fired clay rather than simple dried mud. Several tablets were found together, indicating they may have been part of a merchant's records or public announcements.

texts.name: Merchant's Daily Record
texts.notes: Found beneath a collapsed stone counter. Hastily carved with casual script - likely a personal note.

texts.name: Trade Announcement
texts.notes: Discovered near the central plaza entrance. Formal script suggests this was a public proclamation.

texts.name: Inventory List
texts.notes: Found among pottery shards. Clean, precise carving indicates professional record-keeping.

texts.name: Customer Request
texts.notes: Small tablet found near food preparation area. Informal script with finger marks still visible in clay.

texts.name: Payment Record
texts.notes: Located in what appears to be a money-changer's booth. Very orderly script, possibly official documentation.

texts.name: Quality Check
texts.notes: Recovered from a tool merchant's stall. Script shows careful inspection marks between words.

texts.name: Water Trade
texts.notes: Found near ancient well remains. Writing appears weathered, suggesting outdoor use.

texts.name: Fire Sale
texts.notes: Discovered in charcoal merchant's area. Script shows heat damage but remains legible - possibly a price list.
